title: R2H Gateway Website
description: During my entry point into Road to Hire, I was assigned a gateway assignment which was to build a website about a place I want to visit one day. The site showcases some of the popular tourist attractions, cuisine, and history of Osaka, Japan. For the design, I drew inspiration from many tourist sites and formed a wireframe that not only showed my technical foundation but also my character which is what I strive to do in every project. This one I can say is one of my crown achievements.

title: Ericzander Guitars
description: My first fictional ecommerce website where I sell high end musical eqiupment. I built this during my time in Road to Hire. Featuring 3 pages (Home, Products, Contact), I utilized my knowledge in HTML and CSS for the first iteration of the site and then later implemented a React.js overhaul. This is one of my favorite projects. I got a chance to really tap into my imagination and combine my love for music and technology and I plan to continue making improvments and adding new features.

title: Burger Builder
description: This was a react project built with React.js, it's a simple burger building app with a modal pop up function.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe
description: A simple Tic-Tac-Toe game utilizing DOM manipulation and React.js. This was built during a code-along during my time in Road to Hire.

title: Pokemon Inquirer
description: A simple, fun, Node-based, Pokemon game that uses asyncronus JavaScript promises to simulate the nostalgic and addicting gameplay of the turn-based battle game.

title: Tutor US Hackathon
description: During my time in Road to Hire, I collaborated with a team of 5 cohort members to build a fictional, online tutoring website where you can enter in information and have a personalized confirmation message displayed utilizing both a custom and external API while also using RESTful routes.

title: Restaurant Reservation App
description: A sleek, fictional resturant reservation program that was built during a code-along in Road to hire.

title: Github-card
description: An app that utilizes a custom JS API and React to retrieve the username of a specified Github user and social media handle.

title: Hamburger Navbar
description: A showcase of a certain navbar design and functionality on a static one-page program.

title: Code for Justice Hackathion
description: During my time in Road to Hire, I collaborated with a team of 5 other cohort members. Our goal was to create a fictional, non-profit organization website that addressed the issue of human trafficking. I was in charge of creating the resources page and functionality of the hyperlinks attached. This was also an original concept that I brought to the team.

title: To-Do-App
description: A simple To-do list program that takes in information and displays it to the screen. a fresh list can be populated upon refreshing the site.
